title: Mary Cassatt at the Louvre: The Paintings Gallery

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pastel, over etching, aquatint, drypoint, and crayon électrique on tan wove paper.

description: Edgar Degas enjoyed a close friendship with fellow Impressionist Mary Cassatt. To produce this work, he first made an etching of his friend and her sister, Lydia, then covered the sheet with pastel. Degas depicted Mary with her back to the viewer, balancing in a confident pose; her rigid right arm and umbrella move diagonally across the bottom half of the sheet. This air of assurance contrasts with the attitude of Lydia, who is seated and looks up timidly at the art from a guidebook.
medium_display: Pastel, over etching, aquatint, drypoint, and crayon électrique on tan wove paper
inscriptions: Signed recto, lower left, in black chalk: "Degas/ 85"
publication_history:
Loys Delteil, Le Peinture-graveur illustre 9 (Paris, 1906-30), no. 29.

Jean Adhemar and Francoise Cachin, Degas: The Complete Etchings, Lithographs and Monotypes (New York, 1974), no. 54. 

Harold Joachim and Sandra Haller Olsen, French Drawings and Sketchbooks of the Nineteenth Century 2 (Chicago, 1979), p. 43, no. 2G2.

Paul Andre Lemoisne, Degas et son oeuvre (New York,1984), p. 329, no. 583 (ill.).

Sue Welsh Reed and Barbara Stern Shapiro, Edgar Degas: The Painter as Printmaker, exh. cat. (Boston, 1984), no. 52, XII-XIIIa/XX.

Jean Sutherland Boggs, Degas (Paris, 1988), no. 266 (ill.).

Jean Sutherland Boggs, Degas (Chicago, 1996), pp. 47, 50, 71 (ill. detail), 94 (ill.), and 110, pl. 23b.

Chelsea Foxwell et. al, Smart Museum of Art, "Awash in Color: French and Japanese Prints", (University of Chicago 2012), p. 120, fig. 98
exhibition_history:
London, Grafton Gallery, 1905, cat. 49.

Art Institute of Chicago, "Degas in The Art Institute of Chicago," July 19-Sept. 23, 1984, pp. 117-19, cat. 53 (ill.), cat. by Richard R. Brettell and Suzanne Folds McCullagh.

Paris, Galeries Nationales du Grand Palais, "Degas," 1988 cat. 266, p. 440 (ill.); also the National Gallery of Canada, Ottawa, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, N.Y.

Art Institute of Chicago, "Changing Impressions: Experimental Printing from the 17th through the 19th Centuries," Apr. 1 1990-Mar. 3, 1991.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Mary Cassatt: Modern Woman" Oct. 10, 1998-Jan. 10, 1999, cat. 1, p. 108 (color ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, "Impressionism, Fashion & Modernity," June 26-Sept. 22, 2013, pp. 225, 253, 254, 297, cat. 125 (ill.), cat. by Gloria Groom et. al.

Washington D.C., The National Gallery, "Degas, Cassatt," May 11-Oct. 5, 2014, pp. 62, 89, 91, 103, 156, pl. 48 (ill.), cat. by Kimberly A. Jones, et. al.
provenance_text: Sold by Ivan Stchoukine (1869-1908), Moscow, to Galerie Durand-Ruel, Paris, Dec. 28, 1900 [Letter from Durand-Ruel dated May 10, 1983 curatorial file]; sold to Walter S. (1872-1954) and Kate L. (c. 1879-1947) Brewster, Lake Forest, Ill., Apr. 24, 1926 [invoice in curatorial file]; bequeathed by Kate L. Brewster to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1949.
on_loan_display: On loan to Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City for Manet Degas

input: Mary Cassatt at the Louvre: The Paintings Gallery
